subject: p13964474
History: -year-old man with esophageal perforation, respiratory failure and empyema.
Findings: PA and lateral chest radiographs were obtained. Moderate right basilar atelectasis is similar. The left lung is well inflated. Ground-glass opacification in the right lower and middle lobes has improved since prior exam of and significantly improved since. No pneumothorax is present. Cardiac and mediastinal contours are normal.
Impression: Improved aeration of the right lower and middle lobes with persistent ground-glass opacity. Suggest continued chest x-ray followup in one month to evaluate for continued evolution.
